title: V25 AETHER GENESIS: overwrite AppV1 and implement Helix/Living Matter/Creator Cockpit pillars

requirements.text: Fully replace (overwrite) `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` with the exact user-provided V25 “AETHER GENESIS” code block as the new app UI (Landing → Client → Creator), preserving the intended layout, styling, and interaction behavior.

quotes: INSTRUCTION : Remplace INTÉGRALEMENT le code de `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx`.

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` no longer contains the previous V24 implementation and instead contains the V25 code as the app root.
`frontend/src/App.tsx` continues to render `AppV1` as the root component (no entrypoint rewiring).
The app boots and shows the V25 landing screen with actions to enter Client mode and Creator mode.

requirements.text: Apply only the minimal mechanical fixes required for this repository to compile and run with the pasted V25 code, without altering the intended V25 UI/UX behavior.

quotes: appliquant uniquement les corrections mécaniques nécessaires pour que le projet compile dans ce dépôt sans modifier le design ni la logique prévue.

acceptanceCriteria: No unresolved identifiers remain after the overwrite (e.g., fix the `INITIAL_SALONS` reference so it correctly initializes from the V25 `DATA` constant, or define `INITIAL_SALONS` accordingly).
All referenced imports exist and the build succeeds (Vite/React app renders without runtime crash).
Any unused imports that break the build (if the repo enforces no-unused-vars as errors) are removed or used, while keeping visible behavior unchanged.

requirements.text: Ensure the V25 Helix navigation (service-first top bar) correctly filters the salon feed instantly by category selection, including the “Tout” category showing all salons.

quotes: NAVIGATION "HELIX" (SERVICE-FIRST) : Une barre de navigation supérieure qui agit comme un filtre biologique. On sélectionne l'ADN du service (Ciseaux, Pinceau, Main) et l'interface mute instantanément.

acceptanceCriteria: Selecting each HelixNav category updates the visible salon list immediately without requiring navigation or refresh.
If no salons match, an explicit empty state is shown (as in the provided code), and the screen does not crash.

requirements.text: Implement the missing “Living Matter” card behaviors described by the user while preserving the V25 aesthetic: (1) an integrated swipe gallery experience, (2) a fused fashion-magazine-style bio + contact presentation, and (3) availability rendered as pulsing ‘heartbeat’ dots on the salon surfaces.

quotes: CARTES "LIVING MATTER" : Les salons ne sont pas des images statiques. Ce sont des fenêtres vivantes.
Bio & Contact fusionnés dans un design de magazine de mode.
Disponibilités affichées comme des "Battements de cœur" (Pulsing dots).

acceptanceCriteria: Each salon card (and/or expanded view) exposes a swipeable gallery interaction (drag/swipe) when a salon has multiple images; on desktop, an equivalent mouse drag interaction works.
The expanded salon view shows bio and contact details in a single composed ‘editorial’ block (not separated into disjoint sections) consistent with the V25 design language.
A set of pulsing dot indicators is rendered to represent availability; the dots visibly pulse (CSS or motion) and are data-driven from a local in-file slot list (no backend calls required).

requirements.text: Upgrade the Creator Cockpit to match the specified V25 requirements: provide Live Preview (split view on large screens, modal preview on mobile) and an “AI Assist” button that generates an ‘Aura’ marketing description locally (no external AI services).

quotes: LE "CREATOR COCKPIT" : ... Live Preview : L'écran est divisé (sur grand écran) ou modal (mobile). On voit le résultat pendant qu'on tape.
IA Assist : Un bouton qui génère une "Aura" (Description marketing) automatiquement.

acceptanceCriteria: On large screens, the Creator Cockpit shows an always-visible preview panel that updates live as the user edits name/category/city/type/tags/images/bio.
On small screens, the preview is accessible via a modal/sheet that can be opened while editing, and reflects changes live.
The “AI Assist” action generates a plausible marketing ‘Aura’ text locally (template/heuristic-based) and inserts it into the bio/description field without calling any external API.
The deploy/publish action still creates a new salon in local state and returns to landing/client flow as intended.

requirements.text: Make the Creator “deploy” state update robust against stale closures: when adding a newly deployed salon, update `salons` using a functional state update so the new salon always appears immediately at the top of the Client list.

quotes: setSalons([{ id: Date.now(), ...newSalon, images, rating: "5.0", location: newSalon.city, services: newSalon.services }, ...salons]);

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the V25 deploy action always inserts the newly created salon at the top of the salons feed on the next Client view, even after multiple deploys in a single session.
No race/stale state behavior occurs if deploy is triggered quickly multiple times (the list order remains correct with newest on top).

constraints: Do not modify any frontend immutable entry files (including `frontend/src/main.tsx` and the immutable hooks/UI component sources).
Keep `frontend/src/App.tsx` as the thin wrapper that renders `AppV1`.
Do not add backend calls; keep the V25 experience strictly local/in-memory as implied by the provided code.
Preserve user-provided URLs and seed data exactly as given in the V25 code block unless a change is strictly required to fix a build-breaking error.
nonGoals: Do not (re)introduce Internet Identity authentication, role-based routing, or React Query data loading for V25.
Do not implement real backend persistence, bookings persistence, image upload to Motoko, or any canister schema changes as part of this V25 frontend overwrite.
Do not refactor the V25 code for architecture/cleanliness beyond minimal mechanical compile fixes.
